thread.title: 10 lunches to make for work without actually cooking ANYTHING
thread.title_full: 10 lunches to make for work without actually cooking ANYTHING

author: Stephanie Hallett
title: 10 lunches to make for work without actually cooking ANYTHING
text:
10 lunches to make for work without actually cooking ANYTHING You know the scene: You tried to get up early enough to make a filling, healthy lunch for work , but then your dog got sick, or your kid had a meltdown, or you were just feeling a little ~extra~ in the shower and took forever to get out of that steamy warm goodness. Whatever the situation, you need a good work lunch PRONTO — preferably one that requires no cooking.
Ask and you shall receive, friends! We’re here to help. Below, we’ve rounded up 10 of the best no-cook weekday lunch recipes from our favorite food blogs. Some can be made ahead and stored for the week, while others are easy enough to whip up when you have just a few minutes to spare before dashing out the door. We hope you enjoy — and save yourself a few bucks on eating out this week, too.
Here are 10 lunches you can make for work that require no cooking whatsoever.
1. Moroccan Carrot Noodle Salad with Golden Raisins, Goat Cheese, and Harissa A Cozy Kitchen Use a peeler, mandolin, or spiralizer to whip up these carrot “noodles,” then add a load of savory Moroccan flavors for a lunch you’ll actually look forward to eating. Get the recipe from A Cozy Kitchen .
2. Crunchy Hummus Wraps Big Girls, Small Kitchen This recipe features chipotle hummus for a slightly different take on a classic spread. Add crunchy veggies, wrap it all up in a soft flour tortilla, and…mmm. Get the recipe from Big Girls, Small Kitchen .
3. Lemony Lentil and Chickpea Salad with Radish and Herbs Cookie & Kate This hearty, heavenly dish can be made with pre-cooked lentils for an easy-peasy weekday lunch that satisfies. Get the recipe from Cookie & Kate .
4. Kale & Apple Salad with Avocado Pita Love and Lemons Easy as heck and hearty enough to satisfy, you could throw the ingredients for this pita sandwich into your bag in the morning and handle assembly at the office. Get the recipe from Love and Lemons .
5. Butter Bean, Celery, and Pepita Salad with Winter Citrus A Cozy Kitchen This one’s for the celery lovers. Fill your bowl with its delicious crispiness and add plenty of beans and pepitas for protein. Get the recipe from A Cozy Kitchen .
6. Deb’s Kale Salad with Apple, Cranberries and Pecans Cookie & Kate Kale is a great option for work lunches because it can hold up for a couple of days covered in salad dressing, unlike most leafy greens. So you can make this salad ahead and enjoy it through at least Wednesday. Get the recipe from Cookie & Kate .
7. Cubed, Hacked Caprese Smitten Kitchen We love this recipe because it’s a great starting point for many meals: throw it on soft bread for lunch; mix it with cooked pasta for dinner; add cubes of salami for a little extra protein. Get the recipe — and more ideas! — from Smitten Kitchen .
8. Apple, Pecan, and Feta Salad with Honey Apple Dressing Jessica in the Kitchen This is fresh, crunchy, summertime goodness in a bowl. Save this salad for the dog days of summer when all you want for lunch is for someone else to cook it for you. Get the recipe from Jessica in the Kitchen .
9. Chickpea Salad with Carrots and Dill Cookie & Kate As its creator describes it, this salad is “crisp and fresh, with lots of zip.” What more could you ask for? Get the recipe from Cookie & Kate .
10. Veggie Club Sandwich A Cozy Kitchen Feel good about your choice to pack this sandwich for lunch. It’s healthy and satisfying, and it will keep you full till well past the 3 p.m. slump. Get the recipe from A Cozy Kitchen .
